connections.description: Taylor summarizes the distribution of Latin colonies by tribe, including Nepet in the tribus Stellatina.

references.formattedCitation: Taylor, Lily Ross, and Jerzy Linderski. The Voting Districts of the Roman Republic: The Thirty-Five Urban and Rural Tribes. 2nd ed. 1 vols. Papers and Monographs of the American Academy in Rome 34. Ann Arbor: University of Michigan Press, 2013. http://www.worldcat.org/oclc/793581620.

connections.title: tribus Stellatina

references.formattedCitation: Talbert, Richard. “Database: Peutinger Map Names and Features, with Commentary and User’s Guide.” In Explore the Peutinger Map. Cambridge UP, 2010. http://www.cambridge.org/us/talbert/talbertdatabase/prm.html.

description: Nepet had become a Roman town before 396 B.C. when Livy dubs it, along with Sutrium, as one of the "keys" to Etruria. It became a Roman colony in 383 B.C. and a municipium after the Social War.
